p: In the present study, using cultural techniques, 2 of 106 samples (1.88%) were positive for Listeria strains. No Listeria was isolated from fresh fish samples. In contrast, 2 shrimp (5%) samples were contaminated with L monocytogenes (2.5%) and L grayi (2.5%). The resistance pattern of Listeria spp isolates to 16 antibiotics tested in this study is shown in Table 1. The 2 isolates (100%) were multidrug resistant. In addition, 2 isolates were susceptible to trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole and ciprofloxacin. The L monocytogenes was more sensitive to antibiotics than L grayi.
